tool.name: pRESTO CollapseSeq
tool.command:
ln -s '$fastq_in' in.fastq && CollapseSeq.py -s in.fastq -n '$n' --uf $uf --cf $cf --act $act $inner $keepmiss
#if $representative.select_by == "by_min" --minf '$minf' #end if #if $representative.select_by == "by_max" --maxf '$maxf' #end if
--outname=tmp #if $capture_log --log '$log_out' #end if

param.label: Max Missing
param.help: Maximum number of missing nucleotides to consider for collapsing sequences. A sequence will be considered undetermined if it contains too many missing nucleotides.

param.label: Unique Field(s)
param.help: Space-separated list of fields to match reads by.

param.label: Copy Field(s)
param.help: Space-separated list of fields to copy into the target sequence headers.

param.label: Action(s)
param.help: Space-separated list of actions to take on Copy Field(s).

param.label: Inner
param.help: If true, trim off any missing/undetermined bases from the ends of reads after collapsing.

param.label: Keep Missing
param.help: If specified, sequences with more missing characters than the threshold set by the -n parameter will be written to the unique sequence output file with a DUPCOUNT=1 annotation. If not specified, such sequences will be written to a separate file.

param.label: Field Name
param.help: Specifies the field whose minimum value determines the retained sequence.

param.label: Field Name
param.help: Specifies the field whose maximum value determines the retained sequence.
